precautions: Ansaid can increase the risk of cardiovascular diseases, especially when they are used for a long-time. Therefore, you must know the following:Stop using ansaid tablet just before or after bypass surgery or any other surgery.Ansaidtablets can disrupt gastrointestinal activities in some people and may cause intestinal bleeding or upset stomach, which can be life-threatening in some cases. Do not use the Ansaid tablet if you or an asthma patient and allergic or sensitive to any of the ingredients present in the medicine or from the medicine of the related group. To make sure Ansaid is safer to use, you must inform your doctor of the following conditions. Any cardiovascular disease, hypertension, higher cholesterol levels, Diabetic, or if you have the habit of smoking. A history of cardiac arrest, stroke, or blood clotting.Gastrointestinal reflux disease, if anyStomach ulcers and abnormal bleeding.Asthma and Kidney or liver-related ailment. A pregnant woman must avoid taking ansaid during the last trimester because it can be harmful to the baby. Inform your doctor if you are an expectant mother or planning to have a baby. Keep the medicine away from children.

title: Nalbin 20MG Inj 1x10 (L)
details: This medicine is used to treat moderate to severe pain, just after Surgery or Childbirth.
precautions: It should not be used in Hypersensitivity to the Nalbuphine, in patients with acute or severe Bronchial asthma, Bradycardia and Inflammatory bowel disease. Should be used with caution in patients with Renal or Liver dysfunction.
effects: It can cause Agitation, Hallucinations, Fever, Sweating, Shivering, Fast heart rate, Muscle stiffness, Twitching, Loss of coordination, Nausea, Vomiting, or Diarrhea.

title: Ponstan Oral 250MG Tab 10x60 (L)
details: It is used for the short-term treatment of mild to moderate Pain. It is also used to decrease Pain and Blood loss from menstrual periods.
precautions: Consult your doctor/Pharmacist if you have, Aspirin-sensitive asthma, Severe kidney disease, Recent heart bypass surgery (CABG), Active bleeding/sores in stomach/intestines. It is not recommended for use during the first and last trimesters of Pregnancy due to possible harm to the unborn baby and interference with normal labor/delivery. This drug passes into breast milk and may have undesirable effects on a nursing infant. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding.
effects: Upset stomach, Nausea, Heartburn, Dizziness, Drowsiness, Diarrhea, and Headache may occur.
